The closure of every open set is open.

type: ∀ {X : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] [self : ExtremallyDisconnected X] (U : Set X), IsOpen U → IsOpen (closure U)
name: ExtremallyDisconnected.open_closure
docString: The closure of every open set is open.

An open set is a subset of the interior of another set if and only if it is a subset of that set.

type: ∀ {X : Type u} {s t : Set X} [inst : TopologicalSpace X], IsOpen s → (s ⊆ interior t ↔ s ⊆ t)
name: IsOpen.subset_interior_iff
docString: An open set is a subset of the interior of another set if and only if it is a subset of that set.

This theorem states that for any Ringed Space `X` and any open subset `U` of the underlying topological space of `X`, given a section `f` in the presheaf of `X` over `U`, the basic open set generated by `f` is a subset of `U`. In other words, the basic open set is the set of all points where the germ of `f` (i.e., its localization at a point) is a unit in the ring of all germs, and this set of points is guaranteed to be contained within `U`.

type:
∀ (X : AlgebraicGeometry.RingedSpace) {U : TopologicalSpace.Opens ↑↑X.toPresheafedSpace}
  (f : ↑(X.presheaf.obj (Opposite.op U))), X.basicOpen f ≤ U
name: AlgebraicGeometry.RingedSpace.basicOpen_le
docString: This theorem states that for any Ringed Space `X` and any open subset `U` of the underlying topological space of `X`, given a section `f` in the presheaf of `X` over `U`, the basic open set generated by `f` is a subset of `U`. In other words, the basic open set is the set of all points where the germ of `f` (i.e., its localization at a point) is a unit in the ring of all germs, and this set of points is guaranteed to be contained within `U`.

Two different points can be separated by open sets.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_1 : T2Space X] {x y : X},
  x ≠ y → ∃ u v, IsOpen u ∧ IsOpen v ∧ x ∈ u ∧ y ∈ v ∧ Disjoint u v
name: t2_separation
docString: Two different points can be separated by open sets.

In any topological space, the union of a collection of open sets is an open set.

type:
∀ {X : Type u} [self : TopologicalSpace X] (s : Set (Set X)),
  (∀ t ∈ s, TopologicalSpace.IsOpen t) → TopologicalSpace.IsOpen s.sUnion
name: TopologicalSpace.isOpen_sUnion
docString: In any topological space, the union of a collection of open sets is an open set.

This theorem states that in any topological space `X`, if we have a collection `s` of subsets of `X`, where each subset is an open set, then the union of all subsets in this collection (denoted as `s.sUnion`) is also an open set. In other words, in the context of topology, the union of a family of open sets remains open.

type:
∀ {X : Type u} [self : TopologicalSpace X] (s : Set (Set X)),
  (∀ t ∈ s, TopologicalSpace.IsOpen t) → TopologicalSpace.IsOpen s.sUnion
name: TopologicalSpace.isOpen_sUnion
docString: This theorem states that in any topological space `X`, if we have a collection `s` of subsets of `X`, where each subset is an open set, then the union of all subsets in this collection (denoted as `s.sUnion`) is also an open set. In other words, in the context of topology, the union of a family of open sets remains open.

The preimage of an open set, as an open set.

type:
{α : Type u_2} →
  {β : Type u_3} →
    [inst : TopologicalSpace α] →
      [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace β] → C(α, β) → FrameHom (TopologicalSpace.Opens β) (TopologicalSpace.Opens α)
name: TopologicalSpace.Opens.comap
docString: The preimage of an open set, as an open set.

Dense open sets are residual.

type: ∀ {X : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] {s : Set X}, IsOpen s → Dense s → s ∈ residual X
name: residual_of_dense_open
docString: Dense open sets are residual.

The image of an open immersion as an open set.

type:
{X Y : AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme} →
  (f : X ⟶ Y) → [H : AlgebraicGeometry.IsOpenImmersion f] → TopologicalSpace.Opens ↑↑Y.toPresheafedSpace
name: AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme.Hom.opensRange
docString: The image of an open immersion as an open set.

An open set is a Gδ set.

type: ∀ {X : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] {s : Set X}, IsOpen s → IsGδ s
name: IsOpen.isGδ
docString: An open set is a Gδ set.

Each set from the partially refined family is open.

type:
∀ {ι : Type u_1} {X : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] {u : ι → Set X} {s : Set X}
  (self : ShrinkingLemma.PartialRefinement u s) (i : ι), IsOpen (ShrinkingLemma.PartialRefinement.toFun self i)
name: ShrinkingLemma.PartialRefinement.isOpen
docString: Each set from the partially refined family is open.

Any open set is the union of the basis sets contained in it.

type:
∀ {α : Type u} [t : TopologicalSpace α] {B : Set (Set α)},
  TopologicalSpace.IsTopologicalBasis B → ∀ {u : Set α}, IsOpen u → u = ⋃₀ {s | s ∈ B ∧ s ⊆ u}
name: TopologicalSpace.IsTopologicalBasis.open_eq_sUnion'
docString: Any open set is the union of the basis sets contained in it.

The basic open sets for the topology on ultrafilters are open.

type: ∀ {α : Type u} (s : Set α), IsOpen {u | s ∈ u}
name: ultrafilter_isOpen_basic
docString: The basic open sets for the topology on ultrafilters are open.

The complement of a closed set as an open set.

type: {α : Type u_2} → [inst : TopologicalSpace α] → TopologicalSpace.Closeds α → TopologicalSpace.Opens α
name: TopologicalSpace.Closeds.compl
docString: The complement of a closed set as an open set.

A set is clopen if it is both closed and open.

type: {X : Type u} → [inst : TopologicalSpace X] → Set X → Prop
name: IsClopen
docString: A set is clopen if it is both closed and open.

Points of a finite set can be separated by open sets from each other.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_1 : T2Space X] {s : Set X},
  Set.Finite s → ∃ U, (∀ (x : X), x ∈ U x ∧ IsOpen (U x)) ∧ Set.PairwiseDisjoint s U
name: Set.Finite.t2_separation
docString: Points of a finite set can be separated by open sets from each other.

Open-open circular interval

type: {α : Type u_1} → [inst : CircularPreorder α] → α → α → Set α
name: Set.cIoo
docString: Open-open circular interval

Every set open in the upper topology is a upper set.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Preorder α] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_2 : Topology.IsUpper α] {s : Set α},
  IsOpen s → IsUpperSet s
name: Topology.IsUpper.isUpperSet_of_isOpen
docString: Every set open in the upper topology is a upper set.

The range of an open embedding is an open set.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} {Y : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Y] {f : X → Y},
  OpenEmbedding f → IsOpen (Set.range f)
name: OpenEmbedding.open_range
docString: The range of an open embedding is an open set.

The (open) thickening is an open set.

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {δ : ℝ} {E : Set α}, IsOpen (Metric.thickening δ E)
name: Metric.isOpen_thickening
docString: The (open) thickening is an open set.

The image of the restriction of an open set to the source is open.

type:
∀ {X : Type u_1} {Y : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Y] (e : PartialHomeomorph X Y)
  {s : Set X}, IsOpen s → IsOpen (↑e '' (e.source ∩ s))
name: PartialHomeomorph.isOpen_image_source_inter
docString: The image of the restriction of an open set to the source is open.

An open set belongs to its own set neighborhoods filter.

type: ∀ {X : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] {s : Set X}, IsOpen s → s ∈ nhdsSet s
name: IsOpen.mem_nhdsSet_self
docString: An open set belongs to its own set neighborhoods filter.

Every set open in the lower topology is a lower set.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Preorder α] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_2 : Topology.IsLower α] {s : Set α},
  IsOpen s → IsLowerSet s
name: Topology.IsLower.isLowerSet_of_isOpen
docString: Every set open in the lower topology is a lower set.

The complement of an open set as a closed set.

type: {α : Type u_2} → [inst : TopologicalSpace α] → TopologicalSpace.Opens α → TopologicalSpace.Closeds α
name: TopologicalSpace.Opens.compl
docString: The complement of an open set as a closed set.
